title: Getting started with git
description: During this challenge, you will create a repository on GitHub, clone it to your local machine, add files, commit those changes, push them back to GitHub, and then deploy your web site to your student web server. If you complete all the steps, you will have learned the techniques necessary for managing and deploying a web site!

title: Core HTML and CSS concepts
description: In this challenge, you'll practice your core HTML and CSS skills by building a web-page for a fictitious coffee shop.  The result will be a great looking web and mobile friendly site.   You'll also leverage your version control abilities and publish this website on your student server.

title: Mapping police shootings with Leaflet.js
description: In this challenge, you'll use Leaflet.js to create an interactive map of crowd sourced police-shooting data.  As you know, this is a sensitive issue, so please be thoughtful in the way you discuss and complete you work.

title: Build a CRUD web application
description: In this challenge you'll use the Parse engine to store data from your site usage

title: Spotify challenge
description: In this challenge, you will build an angular application that requests data from the Spotify API.  A sample structure will be provided in lecture to get you started, and to give you a springboard for thinking creatively about what you can do with the data.

title: Build a multi-page personal portfolio
description: This is an opportunity to build a personal online portfolio of your work.  The core skill of this challenge is building a website with multipage architecture

title: Project Description
description: At this point in the quarter, you'll need to turn in a formal description of your final project.

title: Teaching presentation
description: In this group challenge, you will find a JavaScript library and teach your fellow students how to use it.  Your interactive presentation will include a short exercise that demonstrates the implementation of the package.

title: Group project
description: As a final assessment, your group will take on a self-directed project of developing a robust web application.  This fully functional webpage will build upon course skills to tackle a challenge of your choice.

title: Project evaluation
description: Please fill out this evaluation of how your group performed.
